title: The "please don't end" attitude when winning games should be reportable
body:
AH TUT TUT, to those who are either punished or those who thinks the report system is ridiculous for banning toxicity, please leave this thread.

------

Now, as I was saying, I'm sure everyone one of you guys out there have always experienced the times when your team is:

- winning hard.
- getting objectives in time.
- highly skilled in outplaying enemies (_yea, being Yasuo or Lee, w/e_)

The kill score board is now, for example, 24 v 5, you  managed to destroy an inhibitor or 2, your team has 90% chances of being able to rush down the team base for the win, but NOPE.

Your teammate goes: **"Please don't end the game yet. This is so fun!"**

And before you know it, your team gets mighty cocky trying to 1v5 the enemy team one by one, dies steadily, enemies managed to pick up the pace, & ended your Nexus with a sour Defeat.

-----

So my point comes to this. Please make the "_don't end the game yet_" attitude to be reportable & thus punishable for it. This shows nothing but unnecessary taunting to the enemies for being pathetically weak, and I'm sure the enemy team doesn't like this sort of attitude as well (_mostly in Normals, but in Ranks it's mostly regarded as a jail-free card_). I swear that in about 70% of my winning games, I'm usually the only one hitting the enemy Nexus for the win, while the others just jerks off at the enemy fountain...

replies.body: I find people who jerk off before fountain to be more annoying and toxic than people who say 'gg ez'
Don't they tend to be the same people, tho?

> [{quoted}](name=tombdragon,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=lnZ8A1t1,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-10-17T16:48:00.995+0000)
>
> Don't they tend to be the same people, tho?

Not always ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

Legit question here: what would you consider as jerking off before the fountain?

Because, if we're about to win, I attack the nexus normally until the last second, where I'd probably use my sums/ult. Do people consider this annoying, because I personally have never had a problem with this. 

I know this isn't what's described in the OP but I'm asking just in case it does annoy people.

Standing before fountain spamming mastery/emote/dance/laugh and what not without attacking nexus. I don't mind people burning flash/ult whatever they have to actually attack nexus and finish the game but some people just do above mentioned things without touching nexus single time.
Blowing all your shit before it end isn't toxic whatsoever. I think everyone blows everything just before it ends because why not? Even the losing team does it at times.
Agreed. I also find it highly unsportsmanlike and rude to the players of the other team.

At that point you might as well say people shouldn't refuse to surrender/open mid in games clearly lost because it's unsportsmanlike to people who want to move on to play a game where they have fun and to opponents who want a game that isn't easy.

"please make anything that is against my opinion reportable"
"Please make it reportable if after an ace my team dont listen to me to get baron"

Geez, if you lost a game because you didnt close it in time, it's YOUR fault, BUT! Why should anyone be reported and punished for it? Do you report people who feed hard in lane because they're outmatched? No...

So stop trying to make everything you dont agree with a bannable offense.

What logic is this.....

If your team has found the chance to end the game, you TAKE IT, not standing around doing nothing but waiting for the enemies to come back up just to be greedy for more kills. This is nothing but bad-mannered, and should not be promoted excessively. 

Also note that I'm not blaming for those who doesn't know which objectives to take first, like turret/dragon/baron etc. I'm referring to those who just doesn't want to cooperate in helping the team to end the game due to his unnecessary "_don't end, I want to get more kills since it's fun_" attitude.

If the losing team is so much in the gutter they can surrender, if they dont wanna surrender and take every chance they get - the enemy team is giving them more than enough.
Is it kind of a jerk move to kill enemy players when nexus is wide open? - yes
Is taunting someone (ctrl3 ) after a kill a jerk move - also yes
Should both be a "reportable offens"? Hell no,

My point is, there are more than enough tools to deal with this "problem" and banning people for playing the game isn't the solution, there is a certian line pf freedom that should not be crossed.

Being a jerk & doing unnecessary taunting done by torturing the enemy team by killing them on sight instead of ending the game is already a sight of unsportsmanship conduct, no matter how you look at it. I'd even report my own team for doing this kind of behavior. 

There are others who thinks their taunting is a dumb strategy for them to comeback, and thus they have the option to not report them. However, there ARE still players who are just stuck in having to endure the whole game getting rekt all the time because his teammates doesn't want to surrender, despite being excessively behind, thus should have the rights to report the enemy team if such action was seen.

> [{quoted}](name=BeatzBoyFTW,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=lnZ8A1t1,comment-id=0007000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-17T16:53:00.502+0000)
>
> Being a jerk & doing unnecessary taunting done by torturing the enemy team by killing them on sight instead of ending the game is already a sight of unsportsmanship conduct, no matter how you look at it. I'd even report my own team for doing this kind of behavior. 
> 
> There are others who thinks their taunting is a dumb strategy for them to comeback, and thus they have the option to not report them. However, there ARE still players who are just stuck in having to endure the whole game getting rekt all the time because his teammates doesn't want to surrender, despite being excessively behind, thus should have the rights to report the enemy team if such action was seen.

If your team doesnt want to surrender it's also their choice, again this comes to the point wherr you just want to punish people for not doing what YOU want, if the whole team doesnt surrender, maybe they wanna try yo comeback even when you think it's impossible, maybe they are having fun.
Punishing anyone for playing the game is wrong, league of legends is a COMPETETIVE game! Taunting and competitiom will always be there, yes lines can be crossed like racisem, cursing and greifing, but banning someone for not closing the game? please, get over yourself.

> If your team doesnt want to surrender it's also their choice, again this comes to the point wherr you just want to punish people for not doing what YOU want, if the whole team doesnt surrender, maybe they wanna try yo comeback even when you think it's impossible, maybe they are having fun.

I'm beginning to think that you've misread on what I wrote. I'm referring to myself wanting to report my winning team with teammates who refuse to close the game out because they simply want to have fun by bm-killing the losing team constantly, despite having the wide open chance to end the game, especially times where they refuse to hit the Nexus simply because they're reading their Flash for fountain dive after the game ends. 

> Punishing anyone for playing the game is wrong, league of legends is a COMPETETIVE game! Taunting and competitiom will always be there, yes lines can be crossed like racisem, cursing and greifing, but banning someone for not closing the game? please, get over yourself.

I'm still sticking to my fact from the previous comment. Like I said, I only see where the team goes "i'm not finishing this game cz I want more kills" to be reportable, not the ones who sucks in grabbing objectives due to his inexperience.

In school playing sports against other schools then saying out loud, "Wow, these guys are terrible, let's play bad intentionally" gets you into detention, and possibly suspended

In olympics, if a guy loses and as you shake his hand for a good game, then pull it back to brush your hair at the last second, you're going to be considered a terrible person.

In LoL, not winning intentionally is feeding or grieving, as not winning means bringing yourself closer to losing.

> [{quoted}](name=BeatzBoyFTW,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=lnZ8A1t1,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-10-17T15:09:19.376+0000)
>
> AH TUT TUT, to those who are either punished or those who thinks the report system is ridiculous for banning toxicity, please leave this thread.
> 
> ------
> 
> Now, as I was saying, I&#039;m sure everyone one of you guys out there have always experienced the times when your team is:
> 
> - winning hard.
> - getting objectives in time.
> - highly skilled in outplaying enemies (_yea, being Yasuo or Lee, w/e_)
> 
> The kill score board is now, for example, 24 v 5, you  managed to destroy an inhibitor or 2, your team has 90% chances of being able to rush down the team base for the win, but NOPE.
> 
> Your teammate goes: **&quot;Please don&#039;t end the game yet. This is so fun!&quot;**
> 
> And before you know it, your team gets mighty cocky trying to 1v5 the enemy team one by one, dies steadily, enemies managed to pick up the pace, &amp; ended your Nexus with a sour Defeat.
> 
> -----
> 
> So my point comes to this. Please make the &quot;don&#039;t end the game yet&quot; attitude to be reportable &amp; thus punishable for it. This shows nothing but unnecessary taunting to the enemies for being pathetically weak, and I&#039;m sure the enemy team doesn&#039;t like this sort of attitude as well (_mostly in Normals, but in Ranks it&#039;s mostly regarded as a jail-free card_). I swear that in about 70% of my winning games, I&#039;m usually the only one hitting the enemy Nexus for the win, while the others just jerks off at the enemy fountain...


Obviously you never watched Faker play solo queue, he'd be the first player permanent banned from League of Legends if they imposed these ridiculous ideas. League of Legends is a GAME, it's designed for players to HAVE FUN PLAYING. If you are that much of a try hard that you feel you should ruin someone else's fun while playing a game then who really is the villain in this situation?

If It's a player on your own team, just ignore them and push the nexus.  I hate when its on the other team.  If it's 10 min in and theyre 20-1, have taken an inhib already, and decide to camp your nexus until 20 min, that's just rude.  Especially when they have a diamond smurf carrying 80% of the kills, allowing the rest of the team to focus on being dicks.  If that team doesn't end and loses after falling off, they 100% deserve it.
Not ending is just unsportsmanlike, and it only takes 1 person to push the last waves and end.
I dunno if I would say it's punishable, but if it's on my team I definitely ignore them.

It's intentional feeding, or assisting the enemy. Either way it is purposefully taking actions that prevent your teammates from winning.

If it's normals, I usually don't mind having some extra fun. If it's ranked, I'll ignore, and report if they throw it by doing stupid shit like that.

You're right about assisting the enemy. That's a good way to think of it. People who do this are basically buying time for the enemy team to possibly make a comeback (whether that's their goal or not...the fact remains)
I usually don't see it manifesting as that, but at that point there's no question about whether it is punishable or not.
I only ask them not to end when I'm trying to be in the family photo end game.

Uh, no? 

Absolutely not. Unless the intention is to let the enemy team win, then I can't see the reason why it should be reportable. People having fun is a GOOD thing. I would not dick around in a ranked game, but in normals? For what reason other than to have fun would you play them? A winning team should rightfully be able to have fun. The losing team should really back up and consider why they lost hard enough that the enemy team feels they can freely do such a thing. And sure, maybe they had a troll or an AFK, but that happens to everybody and simply deciding every little thing needs to be banned is not a good solution. 

Some people like to play League to have fun, and since taunting does not actually do anything harmful, I do not see why it shouldn't be allowed.

Playing devil's advocate here....but can you imagine what its like for the other team? While you're having the time of your life going 46/ 5 as a team, they are going 5/46 and getting more & more miserable the longer the game goes.  You guys messing around, delaying the end just makes things worse for them.  

Does their perspective not matter to you when you're in that situation? (genuine question)

I've been there, on both teams, and I absolutely don't want to prolong the pain or have it prolonged...

Please do this, Riot! It is extremely frustrating when you're about to win and someone/some people on your team decides to keep the game going because they got cocky. A few things can and will (and have) happen:

1. Your team winds up throwing the game and losing
2. It shows unsportsman-like conduct (which I believe is already a punishable offense) because you're basically mocking the enemy team's skills. i.e. "We're so much better than you that we don't even have to destroy your nexus right away. Instead, we'll just dance and laugh around it at your base."
3.  It's counter-productive to players who are actually trying to win the game and playing appropriately.
At the same time when it comes to stomps, surrendering is an option. I totally get the "never give up" mentality, but i believe theres a limit
Have seen a 36 to 6 game get turned around before the other team even got an inhib, miracles do happen sometimes.
This is also true. If you can keep morale up, you can win. Most games though, ppl just give up

i consider it "unsportsmanlike" and it is reportable, added with a note down below on why.
Honestly, everyone should be considerate and just end the game as soon as possible with a "WP" (not everyone likes the GG on the losing side)
yo momma should be reportable
I suppose you're a "Please don't end" person, right?

no but why should such a attitude be reportable?

it's not toxic at all.
Suuuuuuuuuuuuure (not)

it isn't

why should you get reported for wanting to enjoy the game a little bit longer?
at the end it's your fault and your LP if you lose, why should you get double punished?
Because you also punish innocent people in your team and you also mock the enemies.

ah..

and your typical soloq teammate that goes 0/5 in lane shouldn't be punished?
after all you both cause you to lose.
Um, please relate to comments and don't make random arguments.

it is related.

both types of players make you lose.. so why should only the one who throws away his lead should be punished and the guy who fed from the beginning shouldn't?

you can't report every shit. when somebody wants to risk throwing away his lead because he wants to play the game a little longer that's fine. it's his lp too.
Because when somebody does bad they shouldn't be punished more than a lose or lp lose, but if somebody makes you lose a game because he's cocky he should be punished more than just 1 lose.

Riot clearly stated that you can play the game the way you fcking want.

If you want to play Teemo mid it's not reportable even if it's the reason of your loss.. and at the same time it's not reportable to want to drag a game on a little bit longer. It's a game. Games should make fun. so as long as you are not insulting anyone, inting or afk'ing, you can do what you want.

who are you to tell me how i have to play the game?

Because it's feeding. Walking into enemy fountain last minute, stopping your team from winning, it's worse than saying in all chat, "we're doing Baron, please jump in to steal with smite and I'll even let you kill me after"

You know you can lose from it, and gain no benefit from doing it, so why do you do it? Because you're part of the group of people who find feeding fun but want to rationalize it by saying, "oh it's *technically* not feeding, even though it does the exact same thing if not worse" so if you do get banned, you can go complain on behavior boards about how it was unjust

no it's not.

there is a line between wanting your team to lose and doing stuff for fun that's maybe not the best option. only the 1st is reportable.

another example would be picks. riot clearly stated that you can pick whatever you want.
when your team wants you to pick a tank, but you instead pick a champ that doesn't fit in your teamcomp at all that's your decision and not reportable.. even if it is lowering your teams chances to win.

and when your team wants you to end but you want to do some stuff before instead, it's also your decision.

you don't have to play the game for the highest chance of winning, _as long as your intention is not to ruin the game for other on purpose, it's not reportable and that's it._

Yes it is.

People who don't attack the nexus and taunt in front of the fountain have the explicit intention of ruining the game for everyone, and that's it. There is literally no other reason than to mock everyone else, it's not fun to anyone, and even if it was fun to the person doing it, it still wouldn't be allowed as people who feed tend to find feeding fun anyway, even if they didn't care whether their allies raged or not.

A person can walk down mid and die because they like the sound effects and gray screen, that doesn't mean they should feed, even if it was for their fun and not anyone else's detriment.

And as someone who attacks the nexus especially with a 3 man premade all pinging danger on me, I don't care if they don't find it fun. I don't find clicking on a nexus fun, nor do I find comboing a 0/20 Soraka fun, but I still do it even if it ruins their game unless the enemy team makes it clear they're okay with not losing immediately, and I'm in the mood to mess around.

> [{quoted}](name=Shadòw,realm=EUW,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=lnZ8A1t1,comment-id=0000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2016-10-17T18:27:09.341+0000)
>
> no it's not.
> 
> there is a line between wanting your team to lose and doing stuff for fun that's maybe not the best option. only the 1st is reportable.
> 
> another example would be picks. riot clearly stated that you can pick whatever you want.
> when your team wants you to pick a tank, but you instead pick a champ that doesn't fit in your teamcomp at all that's your decision and not reportable.. even if it is lowering your teams chances to win.
> 
> and when your team wants you to end but you want to do some stuff before instead, it's also your decision.
> 
> you don't have to play the game for the highest chance of winning, _as long as your intention is not to ruin the game for other on purpose, it's not reportable and that's it._

it makes the game toxic if riot plans to stick to thier message it will become reportable

You know what was the saying of an wise man? "The rights of a person end where the the rights of other(s) begin". You have the right to have fun in a game but not to do stupid things instead of winning and punishing 4 other people.

sorry that i thought that games aren't only about winning.

it's not like he wanted to lose the game on purpose, i'm pretty sure most players who do this bite themself into the ass after actually losing in the end. they lose LP too, so why should they be double punished?

you say they should be punished more because they caused the other players to lose.. but when you can't finish out a game where you are clearly ahead as 4 (with one player distracting the enemy team by solo killing or whatever he is doing in that time), you were pretty much reliant on _his_ lead that he got _himself_ in the game.

what he does with that lead is his own choice and not yours.

But if he decides to let us lose just cause he's a dick and he wants to mock the enemies he should be double punished, also if 1 persons int feeds why should he be double punished? He loses a game, that's a big punishment.

> decides to let us lose

that's the point, int feeding is deciding to let somebody lose.

wanting to drag out a game a little longer is not wanting to lose.
maybe it causes you to lose in the end.. but that never actually was said players _**intention**_.

do you get it now?

when you want to intentionally lose, **THAT** is reportable.

if you want to play the game longer because you have fun, fine.
and now you come here and want to tell me how i _**have**_ to play the game?
pathetic.

yeah, make absolutely everything reportable, because that definitely makes for the greatest community!
fucking idiots.

report this, report that.

support took a cs, "HE IS DENYING ME, REPROT".

that shitty reporting attitude has gotten way out of hand.
cant even fart while playing league in fear of getting reported.

Bunch of whiny, thin skinned white-knight douchewaffles who cant even take a honest "STFU and play the game" without crying "verbal abuse" and "toxic".

grow some balls!

>yeah, make absolutely everything reportable

especially this

Still gets me every time.

>grow some balls!

To be fair, no one here can grow an extra pair for the guy who posted the stuff above, and he definitely won't do it for himself. I bet he deludes himself into thinking he does have balls.
